programme.title: NBA Countdown
programme.desc: Expert analysts preview the upcoming action in the NBA, evaluating the strengths and weaknesses of each team while breaking down the pivotal matchups; coverage includes exclusive interviews, insightful commentary and special features.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 18 Memphis (23-5, 13-2) won 20 of its last 22 meetings with the Blazers after a 100-77 win on Jan. 26 behind 23 points from PJ Haggerty, who is second in the AAC with 21.3 ppg; UAB (19-9, 12-3) won four-straight games, and is 13-3 at home.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 22 Arizona (19-9, 13-4) defeated the Cyclones, 86-75, in OT on Jan. 27 behind 22 points from Caleb Love; No. 9 Iowa State (21-7, 11-6) dropped its last two games, but is 14-1 at home behind Curtis Jones, who is fourth in the Big 12 with 16.9 ppg.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: James van Riemsdyk scored two goals, and the Blue Jackets won the first game in the home-and-home set at Little Caesars Arena, 5-2, on Feb. 27; Detroit is 7-2-1 over its last 10 games, and the Red Wings are 14-10-3 on the road this season.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Notre Dame claimed an 89-71 victory over Louisville in their first meeting of the season on Feb. 2, led by 34 points and 6 rebounds from Hannah Hidalgo; Liatu King added 16 points and 12 rebounds for the Fighting Irish in the win on the road.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: South Carolina claimed wins over Kentucky in both of their meetings from the 2023-24 season, winning the final matchup on Feb. 25, 2024, with a 103-55 scoreline; Bree Hall posted 18 points and a steal for the Gamecocks in the win on the road.

programme.title: College GameDay
programme.desc: The GameDay crew goes on the road to various locations at different campuses across the country and discusses the biggest games of the week, while evaluating player performances; experts weigh in on trending topics and teams throughout the nation.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Gonzaga (22-8, 13-4) is second in the country in scoring, averaging 87.4 ppg, and won the last 31 meetings with the Dons after an 88-77 win on Feb. 13; San Francisco (23-7, 13-4) is 16-1 at home behind Malik Thomas, who leads WCC scoring.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Golden State claimed a 139-105 victory over Philadelphia in their first meeting of the season on Jan. 2, led by 30 points and 10 assists from Steph Curry; Joel Embiid posted 28 points and 14 rebounds for the 76ers in the loss on the road.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Minnesota claimed wins over Phoenix in their first two meetings of the season, winning the most recent matchup on Jan. 29 with a 121-113 scoreline; Anthony Edwards and Julius Randle combined for 61 points and 14 rebounds in the win on the road.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee and his friends deliver one-of-a-kind opinions on the latest news making headlines in sports and entertainment, along with special segments and guest interviews with some of the biggest names to give a unique experience.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Oklahoma City and San Antonio split wins in their first two meetings of the season, with the Spurs winning the final matchup on Nov. 19 with a 110-104 scoreline; Keldon Johnson posted 22 points and 5 rebounds for San Antonio in the win at home.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon, longtime colleagues and friends, engage in verbal sparring during a fast-paced and wide-ranging discussion about current events in the world of sports; Kornheiser and Wilbon also interview special guests.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: Mike Greenberg, who joined ESPN in 1996 as an anchor, joins former NBA star Jalen Rose for roundtable discussions about the latest sports news making headlines as well as analysis of recent big games and interviews with expert commentators.

programme.title: NBA Courtside
programme.desc: Players get prepared for the upcoming game through their warm-up routines, as cameras go around the arena to see the fans get excited with tipoff nearing and capture the pregame energy before the starting five lineups are announced.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: A panel of reporters from across the country debate trending topics and stories in sports with points being awarded for valid arguments, and at the end of the show, the winner is awarded 30 uninterrupted seconds to discuss any topic of their choice.

programme.desc: Molly Qerim is the moderator while veteran commentators Stephen A. Smith and Max Kellerman discuss and deliberate the latest topics in the world of sports; the debate show also features guest appearances by entertainers, athletes and journalists.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Pittsburgh (16-12, 7-10) dropped six of its last eight games; No. 19 Louisville (22-6, 15-2) won six-straight games, and beat the Panthers, 82-78, on Jan. 11 behind 25 points from Reyne Smith after losing the previous five meetings.

programme.title: UFC Countdown
programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at fighter training camps as they prepare for their marquee matchups on pay-per-view or other televised events to show how they train for the fight, and interviews with the fighters give a look inside the fighter's mind.

programme.title: College Basketball Live Scoreboard
programme.desc: Game commentators provide a detailed look at college basketball games around the country, as they review highlights of some of the top moments, profile the top players, analyze the strengths and weaknesses of competing teams, and more.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: West Virginia (17-11, 8-9) is 3-6 on the road despite Javon Small, who is second in the Big 12 with 18.4 ppg; No. 25 BYU (20-8, 10-5) won five-straight games, including a 73-69 win over the Mountaineers on Feb. 11 behind 16 points from Egor Demin.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Georgia (17-11, 5-10) ended a four-game losing streak with an 88-83 upset of No. 3 Florida behind 21 points from Silas Demary Jr.; Texas (16-12, 5-10) dropped five of its last six despite Tre Johnson, who leads SEC scoring with 20.9 ppg.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: Boston has a five-game losing streak after suffering a 5-1 loss to the Islanders; Pittsburgh ended a four-game slide with a 5-4 overtime win against Philadelphia, and the Penguins won their last meeting with the Bruins, 2-1, on Nov. 29.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Florida Atlantic (15-13, 8-7) lost three straight, but defeated the Bulls, 94-72, on Feb. 2 behind 18 points from Tre Carroll and Matas Vokietaitis; South Florida (13-16, 6-10) dropped five of its last six games, but is 9-5 at home this season.

programme.title: Top Rank Boxing on ESPN
programme.desc: Started in 1973 by Bob Arum and Jabir Herbert Muhammad, Top Rank Boxing showcases some of the biggest names in the sport as one of the premier promoters, as fighters move up the rankings in their weight classes to earn a title bout.

programme.title: UFC Archival PPV
programme.desc: Alex Pereira (9-2) defends his lightweight championship against Jamahal Hill (12-1) in the main event; Zhang Weili (24-3) defends her strawweight title against Yan Xiaonan (17-3); Justin Gaethje (26-4) defends his BMF title vs. Max Holloway (25-7).

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Northern Iowa (20-10, 14-5) won seven of its last eight games, including an 83-69 win over the Braves on Feb. 2 behind 18 points from Max Weisbrod and 17 from Tytan Anderson; Bradley (23-7, 14-5) won five of its last six, and is 12-3 at home.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Kansas State claimed an 87-79 victory over Iowa State in their first meeting of the season on Jan. 30, behind 23 points and 8 assists from Serena Sundell; Audi Crooks posted 28 points and 11 rebounds for the Cyclones in the loss on the road.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The 1996 USA women's basketball team faced more pressure than just winning the gold medal in Atlanta, as the future launch of the WNBA was on the line with a strong performance from a team loaded with a star-studded roster led by Lisa Leslie.

programme.title: E:60
programme.desc: An in-depth newsmagazine featuring a talented pool of reporters and producers from ESPN, presenting profiles of well-known athletes and coaches as well as investigative reports and cutting-edge stories on emerging and established sports.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Boston claimed a 118-106 victory over Denver in their first meeting of the season on Jan. 7, behind a combined 54 points and 15 rebounds from Jayson Tatum and Kristaps Porzingis; Russell Westbrook posted 26 points for the Nuggets in the home loss.

programme.title: TGL Golf
programme.desc: The Bay Golf Club (4-0-0-0) sits atop the standings with eight points and clinched a berth in the playoffs with a 6-3 triumph over Jupiter Golf GC on Feb. 25; Los Angeles Golf Club (3-0-1-1) defeated New York Golf Club in overtime, 5-4, on Feb. 24.

programme.desc: Rivalries come to be for various reasons, but a hit by Claude Lemieux of the Colorado Avalanche on Kris Draper of the Detroit Red Wings in the late 1990s would ignite a rivalry in the NHL that would stand the test of time between the two teams.

programme.title: NBA Today

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: Malika Andrews covers the latest news from around the NBA, breaking down the stories making headlines across the league, highlights and takeaways from recent games, and guest interviews to get a unique perspective on the league.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Wichita State (17-11, 7-8) had its six-game winning streak snapped by UAB, 80-72, on Feb. 27; North Texas (21-6, 12-3) is second in the country in scoring defense, allowing 58.8 ppg, and beat the Shockers, 58-54, on Jan. 29 behind Moulaye Sissoko.

programme.title: TGL Golf
programme.desc: New York Golf Club (1-2-0-1) suffered a 5-4 setback to Los Angeles Golf Club in overtime on Feb. 24; Boston Common Golf (0-3-0-1) is the only team without a win this season after falling to Atlanta Drive GC, 6-3, on Feb. 24.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Coverage of college basketball games.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: TCU claimed an 80-75 victory over Baylor in their first meeting of the season on Jan. 26, behind a combined 45 points and 22 rebounds from Sedona Prince and Madison Conner; Sarah Andrews posted 21 points for the Bears in the loss on the road.

programme.title: IndyCar Qualifying
programme.desc: Drivers aim for the best starting position for the Grand Prix of St. Petersburg, and the fastest time is awarded pole position; Nolan Siegel averaged 100.347 mph last year to win the pole at St. Petersburg, on his way to winning the race.

programme.title: Bassmaster Elite Series
programme.desc: The highest level of professional bass fishing features pro anglers competing all season for the opportunity to win points toward the Progressive Bassmaster Angler of the Year award and to qualify for the Bassmaster Classic.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Connecitcut claimed a 77-45 victory over Marquette in their first meeting of the season on Jan. 1, led by 15 points and 7 rebounds from Sarah Strong; Sylar Forbes posted 20 points and 5 rebounds for the Golden Eagles in the loss at home.

programme.title: NRL Pregame
programme.desc: Analysts preview the upcoming NRL rugby match, breaking down the key players to watch on both teams who could determine the outcome, updated injury reports to see who will be playing and their predictions on who comes away with a win.

programme.title: Indycar INXT Racing
programme.desc: Louis Foster dominated the 2024 season, winning eight of the final 11 races en route to his first NXT title over Jacob Abel by 122 points; Nolan Siegel opened 2024 with a victory at St. Petersburg over Abel for his lone win of the season.

programme.title: Motocross
programme.desc: Wilson Logisitics Arena in Springfield, Missouri hosts the Arena Motocross Nationals for the second time of the season after round 5 in Memphis, Tennessee; Jacob Kurre earned a P3 in Memphis while Jalen McManis narrowly missed out on the main event.

programme.title: FS1 College Hoops Extra
programme.desc: Hosts and analysts provide the latest highlights and scores to games in college basketball from around the country, providing analysis on the games that have concluded and going on, along with a preview of the upcoming matchups.

programme.title: Women's International Rugby
programme.desc: Australian Jillaroos, the three-time defending World Cup champions, have won each of the three all-time meetings with England Women, including a 38-0 victory in the 2017 Women's Rugby League World Cup, as Meg Ward notched two tries.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Ohio State claimed a 74-66 victory over Maryland in their first meeting of the season on Jan. 23, led by 20 points and 8 rebounds from Jaloni Cambridge; Kaylene Smikle posted 17 points and 5 rebounds for the Terrapins in the loss on the road.

programme.title: IndyCar Qualifying
programme.desc: Drivers aim for the best starting position for the Firestone Grand Prix, and the fastest time is awarded pole position; Josef Newgarden averaged 108.777 mph last year to win his first pole at St. Petersburg, but would finish the race in 26th.

programme.title: IndyCar Qualifying
programme.desc: Drivers aim for the best starting position for the Firestone Grand Prix, and the fastest time is awarded pole position; Josef Newgarden averaged 108.777 mph last year to win his first pole at St. Petersburg, but would finish the race in 26th.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: The most talented bowlers in the world compete for lucrative prize money and coveted trophies, challenged by various lane oil patterns throughout the season, requiring bowlers to adjust ball angle, rotation and speed in order to succeed.

programme.title: IndyCar Practice
programme.desc: IndyCar drivers learn the particulars of the track and communicate to their crew how the car is handling and what adjustments need to be made in order to perform at peak efficiency during the Firestone Grand Prix; crews work to set up the car.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: USC claimed a 71-60 victory over UCLA in their first meeting of the 2024-25 season on Feb. 13, led by 38 points, 11 rebounds and 8 blocks from JuJu Watkins; Lauren Betts posted 18 points and 13 rebounds for the Bruins in the loss on the road.

programme.title: NRL Rugby League
programme.desc: Cronulla recorded 38 points to finish fourth in the ladder last season; Penrith, which won its sixth title in club history in 2024, has won eight of the past nine meetings with the Sharks, including a 26-8 triumph last season in Finals Week 3.

programme.title: MotoGP
programme.desc: Jorge Martin finished on the podium in 16 of the 20 races to secure his first MotoGP Championship of his career, beating two-time defending champion Francesco Bagnaia by 10 points; Bagnaia won the race at Thailand last year over Martin.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Connecitcut claimed a 77-45 victory over Marquette in their first meeting of the season on Jan. 1, led by 15 points and 7 rebounds from Sarah Strong; Sylar Forbes posted 20 points and 5 rebounds for the Golden Eagles in the loss at home.

programme.title: Inside the Big East
programme.desc: Insiders and journalists provide a detailed look inside all the action around the Big East, including highlights from the biggest games, discussions on relevant sports topics, previews of upcoming matchups, player profiles, and much more.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Racing
programme.desc: Alex Palou won three races en route to his second-straight IndyCar Series title and third in the last four years, beating Colton Herta by 31 points; Pato O'Ward averaged 96.867 mph en route to his win at St. Petersburg last year over Will Power.

programme.desc: Creighton claimed a 70-57 victory over Villanova in their first meeting of the season on Feb. 8, led by a combined 48 points from Lauren Jensen and Morgan Maly; Jasmine Bascoe posted 21 points and 7 rebounds for the Wildcats in the loss.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball

programme.title: IndyCar Qualifying
programme.desc: Drivers aim for the best starting position for the Grand Prix of St. Petersburg, and the fastest time is awarded pole position; Nolan Siegel averaged 100.347 mph last year to win the pole at St. Petersburg, on his way to winning the race.

programme.title: MLS Soccer
programme.desc: Atlanta United FC (1-0-0) is 3-3-0 all-time in the series after a 1-0 victory on Aug. 31, as Ajani Fortune scored off an assist from Xande Silva in the 55th minute; Charlotte FC (0-0-1) comes off a 2-2 draw with Seattle in its 2025 opener on Feb. 22.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Creighton (20-8, 13-4) won its last three meetings with the Musketeers after an 86-77 win on Jan. 29 behind 29 points from Ryan Kalkbrenner, who is second in Big East scoring; Xavier (18-10, 10-7) won four-straight games, and is 13-2 at home.

programme.title: Saudi Pro League Soccer
programme.desc: Al-Ahli (14-2-6) has won six of its last seven contests; Al-Hilal (16-3-3) is unbeaten in the past eight meetings across all competitions after a 2-1 victory in Week 6, as Aleksandar Mitrovic scored a brace with his match-winner in the 77th minute.

programme.title: Kevin Harvick's Happy Hour
programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: America's Day at the Races
programme.desc: Nationwide coverage of thoroughbred racing from venues around the country, showcasing major stakes races with in-depth analysis from expert handicappers; coverage includes the latest horse racing news, exclusive interviews and insightful commentary.

programme.title: NHRA in 30
programme.desc: Thorough coverage of the latest NHRA events is showcased, including detailed play-by-play, replays of the most exciting and pivotal moments from the race as well as exclusive interviews, special features, insightful commentary and highlights.

programme.title: Mexican Liga MX Soccer
programme.desc: Jurez claimed a 1-0 victory over Pachuca in their most recent meeting on Nov. 9 through a winning strike from scar Estupin in the second half; Aitor Garca provided the assist for the lone goal of the match in the 64th minute of play.

programme.title: IndyCar Practice
programme.desc: IndyNXT drivers learn the particulars of the track and communicate to their crew how the car is handling and what adjustments need to be made in order to perform at peak efficiency in the Grand Prix of St. Petersburg; crews work to set up the car.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Butler (13-15, 6-11) won four of its last six games; Villanova (17-12, 10-8) is 13-3 at home this season, and defeated the Bulldogs, 73-65, on Jan. 1 behind 28 points from Eric Dixon, who leads the country in scoring with 23.3 ppg.

programme.title: IndyCar Warmup
programme.desc: IndyCar drivers get their car ready and make final preparations for the Firestone Grand Prix to open the 2025 season; Alex Palou won the last two IndyCar titles and three of the last four after beating Colton Herta by 31 points last year.

programme.title: NHRA in 30
programme.desc: Thorough coverage of the latest NHRA events is showcased, including detailed play-by-play, replays of the most exciting and pivotal moments from the race as well as exclusive interviews, special features, insightful commentary and highlights.

programme.desc: Professional football players and Grammy award-winning musicians share inspiring messages at the Mahalia Jackson Theater of Performing Arts in New Orleans.

programme.desc: The top anglers across the country compete in a series of annual events that makes up bass fishing's most competitive league, featuring millions of dollars in prizes, tournaments taking place throughout the U.S., and coverage of all the major phases.

programme.desc: Wilson Logisitics Arena in Springfield, Missouri hosts the Arena Motocross Nationals for the second time of the season after round 5 in Memphis, Tennessee; Jacob Kurre earned a P3 in Memphis while Jalen McManis narrowly missed out on the main event.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: TCU claimed an 80-75 victory over Baylor in their first meeting of the season on Jan. 26, behind a combined 45 points and 22 rebounds from Sedona Prince and Madison Conner; Sarah Andrews posted 21 points for the Bears in the loss on the road.

programme.title: Bassmaster Elite Series
programme.desc: The highest level of professional bass fishing features pro anglers competing all season for the opportunity to win points toward the Progressive Bassmaster Angler of the Year award and to qualify for the Bassmaster Classic.

programme.desc: Ohio State claimed a 74-66 victory over Maryland in their first meeting of the season on Jan. 23, led by 20 points and 8 rebounds from Jaloni Cambridge; Kaylene Smikle posted 17 points and 5 rebounds for the Terrapins in the loss on the road.

programme.title: Indycar INXT Racing
programme.desc: Louis Foster dominated the 2024 season, winning eight of the final 11 races en route to his first NXT title over Jacob Abel by 122 points; Nolan Siegel opened 2024 with a victory at St. Petersburg over Abel for his lone win of the season.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Twenty-seven clubs compete in CONCACAF's premier association competition to determine the continental champion of North America, Central America and the Caribbean; the annual tournament celebrated its debut in 1962.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: EJ Tackett, who looks to win his 25th career title and move into a tie with Brian Voss for 11th all-time, leads the tour in points through two events; Graham Fach won the season opener.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: The winner in the semifinal matchup between E J Tackett and Timmy Tan, as well as the victor between Tim Foy Jr. and Dom Barrett advance to compete for the top prize of $30,000; Anthony Simonsen of Las Vegas took home the title in 2024.

programme.title: TMZ Sports
programme.desc: Covering gossip, scandal and the everyday lives of athletes in college and professional sports, the crew comically highlights exclusive footage of the superstars spotted around Hollywood, New York City and other parts of the country.
